body_html:
About the original question related to embedding_lookup. It expects to pass a tensor of ids. If you have a SparseTensor that contains ids in the value part, you can just use embedding_lookup with my_sparse_tensor.values

There is a embedding_lookup_sparse that expects sparse tensors, but it will aggregate the embedding for the same 1st-dimension of the indices, and possibly this is not what you want.

body:
About the original question related to embedding_lookup. It expects to pass a tensor of ids. If you have a SparseTensor that contains ids in the value part, you can just use embedding_lookup with my_sparse_tensor.values

There is a embedding_lookup_sparse that expects sparse tensors, but it will aggregate the embedding for the same 1st-dimension of the indices, and possibly this is not what you want.
